definition: scholar preparing for imperial examinations (in former times)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
person/employee/member
lifeguard

sentences.english: The beach life-guards usually flag one another for communication.
sentences.chinese: 海滨救生员通常用旗号传达信息。

sentences.english: Now the lifeguards have all gone home.
sentences.chinese: 现在救生员全都回家了。

sentences.english: The lifeguard helps Dan out of the water.
sentences.chinese: 救生员帮助丹恩回到岸上。

sentences.english: Some of the equipment is expensive, but hygienists don't cost much.
sentences.chinese: 有些设备很昂贵，但是卫生员的支出并不高。

sentences.english: If there are lifeguards, let them know your plans before you start swimming.
sentences.chinese: 如果有救生员，游泳之前告诉他们你的计划。

sentences.english: Who is a skilled birth attendant?
sentences.chinese: 谁是技术熟练的接生员？

sentences.english: If you can't get back to the beach, tread water and wave for a lifeguard's help.
sentences.chinese: 假如你无法游回岸边，可踩水并向救生员挥手求救。

sentences.english: The lifeguard held the drowning man's head above water.
sentences.chinese: 救生员把溺水者的头托出水面。

sentences.english: Mark won again, splashing the lifeguards even more.
sentences.chinese: 马克又赢了，那些救生员也被溅得更湿了。

sentences.english: The current number of skilled attendants is critically insufficient.
sentences.chinese: 现有技术熟练的接生员的数量是相当不足的。

sentences.english: The lifeguards held a sit-in protest at Repulse Bay in the afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 参加行动的救生员在浅水湾泳滩静坐。

sentences.english: The lifeguard saved the drowning girl at the risk of (losing) his life.
sentences.chinese: 这个救生员冒著生命的危险救起溺水的女孩。

sentences.english: By lending a helping hand to the lifeguards , Scott saved two children from drowning.
sentences.chinese: 斯科特协助救生员救起了两个落水的儿童。

definition: candidate for the Imperial Examination proposed by a tributary state
graduate/successful candidate in the imperial provincial examination
candidate who has not yet passed the county level imperial exam
a person who has passed the county level imperial exam (historical)/scholar/skillful writer/fine talent
(old) candidate who has successfully passed the first grades of the examination system, but not yet the court examination (殿試|殿试[dian4 shi4])
successful candidate in the highest imperial civil service examination/palace graduate
official/scholar (old)
the triennial provincial imperial exam during the Ming and Qing
title of the temporary position in the Hanlin Academy, conferred to meritorious candidates until the next examination
Imperial College (or Academy), the highest educational body in imperial China
Imperial scholar from the Ming Dynasty onwards
successful military candidate in the imperial provincial examination
imperial examination
county head magistrate (old)
low-level government official (in former times)
Imperial College of Supreme Learning, established in 124 BC, and the highest educational institute in ancient China until the Sui Dynasty
